Hazard Identification.Classification: Classification under 2012 OSHA Hazard Communication Standard (29 CFR 1910.1200)

First Aid Measures.Eye Contact: Rinse immediately with plenty of water, also under the eyelids, for at least 15 minutes. Get
First Aid Measures.Skin Contact: Wash off immediately with plenty of water for at least 15 minutes. Get medical attention if
First Aid Measures.Inhalation: Remove to fresh air. If breathing is difficult, give oxygen. Get medical attention.
First Aid Measures.Ingestion: Do NOT induce vomiting. Get medical attention if symptoms occur.

Handling and Storage.Storage: . Keep containers tightly closed in a dry, cool and well-ventilated place.

Exposure Controls.Respiratory Protection: No protective equipment is needed under normal use conditions.
